New Year’s Eve Ban on Open Alcoholic Beverages

To maintain orderly travel on New Year’s Eve, open alcoholic beverages will not be permitted on Metro-North trains and at stations from noon on New Year's Eve until noon on New Year's Day. MTA Police Officers will be on duty at Grand Central Terminal and at train stations and on trains to enforce this restriction. Thank you for your cooperation, and have a safe and happy New Year!

Off-Peak & Family Fares in Effect Christmas Day, Dec. 25

On Thursday, Dec. 25, off-peak fares will be in effect, as well as the Railroad's Family Fare Discount. With the LIRR's Family Fare, kids ages 5-11 (limit of 4 children) can ride one-way for $1 when accompanied by a fare paying parent or guardian. Tickets must be purchased before boarding. Weekly and monthly ticket holders pay just for the kids and, as always, children under 5 ride free.

Recently, we have been experiencing issues with our TrainTime application which effects not only the functionality of our mobile app but the real-time signs at many of our stations. Please contact 511 for NY and 877-690-5114 for CT or visit www.mta.info for schedule and fare information.

J Line – Weekend Planned Service Change

In effect until 5 AM Monday, Dec 15 No J trains between Broadway Junction and Crescent St—take free shuttle buses instead. J service operates in two sections: 1. Between Broad St/Chambers St and Broadway Junction. 2. Between Crescent St and Jamaica Center. Free shuttle buses operate between Broadway Junction and Crescent St, stopping at Alabama Av, Van Siclen Av, Cleveland St, and Norwood Av. • Transfer between J trains and free shuttle buses at Broadway Junction and/or Crescent St. • Consider the E to/from Manhattan via Sutphin Blvd or Jamaica Center. Connecticut Dept. of Transportation (CTDOT) New Haven Line Fare Increase Effective on January 1, 201

A Connecticut Department of Transportation (CTDOT) fare increase of 1% goes into effect on the Connecticut portion of the New Haven Line on January 1, 2015. This is the fourth of seven consecutive annual increases requested by CTDOT to help finance the new M8 cars. This increase will affect ticket prices for travel: --Between Connecticut and New York stations --Between stations within Connecticut Some fares may not change due to rounding and the small percentage of the increase. The fare increase does not affect travel to/from stations within New York State. See http://bit.ly/1yw7Ymh for more info.

Weekend Trackwork Dec. 5-8 May Affect Train Service

LIRR customers should build in extra travel time to allow for potential train delays as the LIRR undertakes an important phase of the East Side Access project, which requires closing two of four East River Tunnels connecting Queens to Manhattan/Penn Station. Proposed Fare Changes; Comment on Video for the Record

LIRR customers can record videotaped comments about the MTA's proposed fare changes this morning (12/4) at Hicksville Station, 6 AM-10 AM, in the street-level waiting room. All comments will be transcribed and made part of the permanent record for review by the MTA Board. Please note there is a 3 minute time limit for each individual's videotaped comments.

LIRR customers can record videotaped comments about the MTA's proposed fare changes at two LIRR stations. Hicksville Station: Thurs. Dec. 9, 6 AM-10 AM, Street-Level Waiting Room All comments will be transcribed and made part of the permanent record for review by the MTA Board.
